api_key.description: The API key to use for authenticating requests to the API. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_API_KEY environment variable. Conflicts with 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret'.

base_url.description: The base URL of the Tailscale API. Defaults to https://api.tailscale.com. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_BASE_URL environment variable.

oauth_client_id.description: The OAuth application's ID when using OAuth client credentials. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID environment variable. Both 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret' must be set. Conflicts with 'api_key'.

oauth_client_secret.description: The OAuth application's secret when using OAuth client credentials. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET environment variable. Both 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret' must be set. Conflicts with 'api_key'.

scopes.description: The OAuth 2.0 scopes to request when for the access token generated using the supplied OAuth client credentials. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1215/oauth-clients/#scopes for available scopes. Only valid when both 'oauth_client_id' and 'oauth_client_secret' are set.

tailnet.description: The organization name of the Tailnet in which to perform actions. Can be set via the TAILSCALE_TAILNET environment variable. Default is the tailnet that owns API credentials passed to the provider.

acl.description: The JSON-based policy that defines which devices and users are allowed to connect in your network

block.description: The acl resource allows you to configure a Tailscale ACL. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1018/acls for more information. Note that this resource will completely overwrite existing ACL contents for a given tailnet.

authorized.description: Whether or not the device is authorized

device_id.description: The device to set as authorized

block.description: The device_authorization resource is used to approve new devices before they can join the tailnet. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1099/device-authorization/ for more details.

device_id.description: The device to update the key properties of

key_expiry_disabled.description: Determines whether or not the device's key will expire. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: The device_key resource allows you to update the properties of a device's key

device_id.description: The device to set subnet routes for

routes.description: The subnet routes that are enabled to be routed by a device

block.description: The device_subnet_routes resource allows you to configure subnet routes for your Tailscale devices. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1019/subnets for more information.

device_id.description: The device to set tags for

tags.description: The tags to apply to the device

block.description: The device_tags resource is used to apply tags to Tailscale devices. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1068/acl-tags/ for more details.

nameservers.description: Devices on your network will use these nameservers to resolve DNS names. IPv4 or IPv6 addresses are accepted.

block.description: The dns_nameservers resource allows you to configure DNS nameservers for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

magic_dns.description: Whether or not to enable magic DNS

block.description: The dns_preferences resource allows you to configure DNS preferences for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

search_paths.description: Devices on your network will use these domain suffixes to resolve DNS names.

block.description: The dns_nameservers resource allows you to configure DNS nameservers for your Tailscale network. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns for more information.

created_at.description: The creation timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

description.description: A description of the key consisting of alphanumeric characters. Defaults to `""`.

ephemeral.description: Indicates if the key is ephemeral. Defaults to `false`.

expires_at.description: The expiry timestamp of the key in RFC3339 format

expiry.description: The expiry of the key in seconds. Defaults to `7776000` (90 days).

invalid.description: Indicates whether the key is invalid (e.g. expired, revoked or has been deleted).

preauthorized.description: Determines whether or not the machines authenticated by the key will be authorized for the tailnet by default. Defaults to `false`.

recreate_if_invalid.description: Determines whether the key should be created again if it becomes invalid. By default, reusable keys will be recreated, but single-use keys will not. Possible values: 'always', 'never'.

reusable.description: Indicates if the key is reusable or single-use. Defaults to `false`.

tags.description: List of tags to apply to the machines authenticated by the key.

block.description: The tailnet_key resource allows you to create pre-authentication keys that can register new nodes without needing to sign in via a web browser. See https://tailscale.com/kb/1085/auth-keys for more information
The 4via6 data source is calculates an IPv6 prefix for a given site ID and IPv4 CIDR. See Tailscale documentation for [4via6 subnets](https://tailscale.com/kb/1201/4via6-subnets/) for more details.

json.description: The contents of Tailscale ACL as JSON

block.description: The acl data source gets the Tailscale ACL for a tailnet

tags.description: The tags applied to the device

user.description: The user associated with the device

wait_for.description: If specified, the provider will make multiple attempts to obtain the data source until the wait_for duration is reached. Retries are made every second so this value should be greater than 1s

block.description: The device data source describes a single device in a tailnet

devices.description: The list of devices in the tailnet

name_prefix.description: Filters the device list to elements whose name has the provided prefix

block.description: The devices data source describes a list of devices in a tailnet
